item.title: Overgrown tree growing through the path on the corner of Randall Close /Park Crescent, 21st July
item.description:
The tree has grown out from a corner of the road and covers the footpath and people have to walk out into the road to get round it it started off as a low branch but has grown massively making it dangerous especially for elderly people like myself it is actually growing out of the footpath!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Crescent, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree rotting and pieces falling down next to my property/ Masonic hall 3 Avenue road, 21st July
item.description:
Tree is rotting chunks have fallen down , what is left is connected to a big branch and I’m worried it will fall on someone.see photo of piece that has fallen today

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People sleeping in Danson Park, 21st July
item.description:
Anonymous caller called report homeless people who have a tent inside the bushes near the tennis court. She witnessed them taking off their tops and wiping them selves down with wipes. She also said there's a old dirty stained period pad which been there for two days now. Please can we inspect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary barrier fence broken and hazardous, 21st July
item.description:
The pyramid slide had been vandalised months ago and the barrier fencing that has been put in place is disintegrating with wires poking out. This has created a hazard for children running around the park. I personally think the broken barriers are more of a hazard than the broken slide.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very squeaky swing in play area, 21st July

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmsted Crescent, West Heath, London

item.title: Slum-like conditions, 21st July
item.description:
Junkies have ripped open bin bags and thrown the contents all throughout the street. There’s rotting food and broken glass left where children play. It has been this way for a number of days now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
